title: Travelers Stranded and Protests Swell Over Trump Order
summary: The White House pulled back on part of Mr. Trump’s temporary ban on visitors from seven countries by saying that it would not apply to those with green cards.

title: Internal Memo at State Department Opposes Trump’s Travel Ban
summary: More than 100 signatures have been gathered for a so-called dissent cable circulating within the State Department opposing President Trump’s executive order banning entry visas from seven predominantly Muslim countries.

title: Trump Vows to ‘Do a Big Number’ on Dodd-Frank Regulations
summary: The president is keeping a campaign pledge by saying once again that plans to dismantle the regulations put into place to prevent another financial crisis like the one in 2008.
tags: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

title: How a Trump Supreme Court Pick Could (or Could Not) Sway Cases
summary: The Supreme Court in Washington this month. President Trump said he would announce a nominee to fill the court’s vacancy on Tuesday.

title: How Republicans Will Try to Roll Back Obama Regulations
summary: Former President Barack Obama at the White House this month. Republican leaders say many of his recently finalized regulations impose an excessive burden on American businesses.

title: Why It’s Already Difficult to Gain Entry Into the U.S.
summary: A protester with a message for President Trump at Kennedy International Airport in New York on Saturday.

title: The Interpreter: Trump’s Immigration Order Tests Limits of Law and Executive Power
summary: A demonstration against President Trump’s immigration order outside Kennedy Airport in New York on Saturday.

title: First 100 Days Briefing: The UN Puts a Figure on the Refugees Impacted: 20,000
summary: President Trump last week on Air Force One.

title: How Trump’s Rush to Enact an Immigration Ban Unleashed Global Chaos
summary: Gen. John F. Kelly, the secretary of Homeland Security, this month. He was still getting his first full briefing on the executive order when President Trump signed it.

title: Primary Colors: Republicans Have One Big Incentive to Stick With Trump
summary: Polling data suggests that the greatest threat to re-election for most Republicans in Congress is a primary challenge.

title: Trump Hotels’ Tweet Draws Backlash After Immigration Order
summary: Demonstrators outside Trump Hotel International in Washington on Sunday.

title: For Leaders of U.S. Allies, Getting Close to Trump Can Sting
summary: President Trump with Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain at the White House on Friday. A close relationship with American presidents is regarded as vital by allies and foes alike, but particularly by countries like Britain, Canada, Japan and Mexico.

title: Trump’s Trade War May Have Already Begun
summary: A crane operates next to shipping containers in Chongqing, China. As the Trump administration threatens to impose punitive tariffs on imported goods, American allies are looking to China, which has capitalized on a leadership vacuum in world affairs by offering itself as a champion for global trade and engagement.

title: Donations to A.C.L.U. and Other Organizations Surge After Trump’s Order
summary: Omar C. Jadwat, center, a lawyer for the American Civil Liberties Union, outside the United States District Court in New York on Saturday, where a judge issued an emergency stay of President Trump’s order for those detained at American airports.

title: Trump’s Immigration Order Jolts Iraqis, U.S.’s Top Allies Against ISIS
summary: A refugee from Mosul, Iraq, at a camp in Syria. Iraq is providing the ground forces for the coming assault against the Islamic State’s stronghold in Mosul.
tags: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

title: Howls Over Import Tax Complicate Plans to Overhaul Code
summary: Larry Kudlow, an economic commentator, in 2015. Mr. Kudlow, who counseled President Trump during the campaign, has spoken out against a proposed 20 percent tax on imports.

title: As Democrats Take to the Streets, Lawmakers Rush to Keep Up
summary: Senator Chuck Schumer addressed protesters on Sunday in Manhattan, tearing up at one point as he called President Trump’s refugee ban an affront to democracy.

title: Reince Priebus Defends Holocaust Statement That Failed to Mention Jews
summary: Reince Priebus, the White House chief of staff, speaking with Steve Bannon, President Trump’s chief strategist.

title: Trump Administration Defends Bannon’s Role on Security Council
summary: Reince Priebus and Stephen K. Bannon attending morning prayer at St. John’s Episcopal Church in Washington after departing from Blair House on Jan 20.

title: Rulings on Trump’s Immigration Order Are First Step on a Long Legal Path
summary: Protesters at San Francisco International Airport demonstrating on Saturday against President Trump’s order barring immigrants coming from certain Muslim-majority countries.

title: Growing Number of G.O.P. Lawmakers Criticize Trump’s Refugee Policy
summary: They expressed concern about an order’s substance and the confusion over the way it was carried out. One said it served as propaganda for ISIS.

title: Trump’s Plan to Fight ISIS Includes Calling It by That Name
summary: An executive memorandum President Trump signed on Saturday afternoon repeatedly referred to the Islamic State as ISIS — not ISIL, as President Barack Obama had called the terrorist group since 2014.
tags: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
